    • Method Detail

      • qualifiedName

        public static String qualifiedName(CharSequence simpleName,
                   CharSequence packageName)
        Qualifies a simple name, if applicable. A package name which is null or which is empty is assumed to refer to the default package. Hence, the returned qualified name will equal the simple name in this case. Otherwise, the package name is prepended, followed by a dot ('.').
        Parameters:
        simpleName - the simple name
        packageName - the package name, or null for the default package
        Returns:
        the qualified name

      • capitalizeFirst

        public static String capitalizeFirst(CharSequence str)
        Capitalizes the first character (if existent) in the given character sequence, and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        str - the character sequence
        Returns:
        a capitalized version of the specified character sequence

      • accessorName

        public static String accessorName(CharSequence userName,
                  CharSequence userPrefix,
                  CharSequence defaultPrefix,
                  CharSequence fieldName)
        Resolves the name of an accessor method by following a certain set of rules.
        1. If userName is both non-null and non-empty, its value is used as the name.
        2. Otherwise, the name consists of a prefix followed by fieldName. The first character of fieldName is capitalized if the prefix is non-empty. The prefix is determined as follows:
          1. If userPrefix is non-null, it is used as the prefix
          2. Otherwise, defaultPrefix is used as the prefix.
        Parameters:
        userName - the user-specified name, or null.
        userPrefix - the user-specified prefix, or null.
        defaultPrefix - the default prefix, or null.
        fieldName - the name of the field
        Returns:
        the name of an accessor method for the specified field, as determined by the above-described rules.

      • getterName

        public static String getterName(CharSequence userName,
                CharSequence userPrefix,
                CharSequence fieldName)
        Convience method. Calling this method is equivalent to calling accessorName(userName, userPrefix, "get", fieldName)

      • resolvePackageName

        public static String resolvePackageName(CharSequence packageNameSpec,
                        CharSequence referencePackage)
        Resolves a name of a package from a specification. A specification is either a fully-qualified package name (including "" for the empty package), or a relative specification beginning with a dot ('.'). In the latter case, the specification will be interpreted as relative to a given reference package name.

        Usage examples:

        • resolvePackageName(null, "com.example") returns "com.example"
        • resolvePackageName("", "com.example") returns ""
        • resolvePackageName("foo.bar", "com.example") returns "foo.bar"
        • resolvePackageName(".", "com.example") returns "com.example"
        • resolvePackageName(".foo.bar", "com.example") returns "com.example.foo.bar"
        Parameters:
        packageNameSpec - the specification of the package name, or null
        referencePackage - the reference package name
        Returns:
        the resolved, fully-qualified package name.

      • firstDefinedName

        public static String firstDefinedName(CharSequence... charSeqs)
        Retrieves the first defined (i.e., non-empty and non-null) name in the given array, and returns it as a String.
        Parameters:
        charSeqs - the name array
        Returns:
        the first defined name as a String, or null if all provided names are undefined.
